H0.text: The Fission Theory and The Coaccretion Theory propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth.

H1.text: The Coaccretion Theory and The Capture Theory propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth.

H2.text: The Fission Theory and the Giant Impact Theory are two theories of Moon formation that propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth.

H3.text: The Capture Theory and the Giant Impact Theory propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth.

A4.text: Another hypothesis attributes the formation of the Moon to the impact of a large asteroid with Earth... creating the satellite primarily from debris from Earth.

A5.text: The stable isotope ratios of lunar and terrestrial rock are identical, implying a common origin.
